body_content.explanation: movement that is quiet and careful in order not to be seen or heard:
examples: She moved across the field with the stealth of a cat on the prowl.
These thieves operate with terrifying stealth - they can easily steal from the pockets of unsuspecting travellers.

body_content.explanation: the quality of carrying an action out secretly, so that people do not know it is happening:
examples: It would seem that some politicians would prefer to use financial stealth rather than legislation to produce change.
The weapons had been acquired by stealth.

body_content.explanation: used to refer to aircraft, weapons, etc. that cannot be seen on radar:
examples: The stealth fighter can fly 1,500 kilometres per hour without detection.
The force relies more heavily on stealth weaponry.

body_content.explanation: used to refer to something that is done secretly, so that people do not know it is happening:
examples: These products work in stealth mode, so that the people being spied on are totally unaware.
